title: Internal server error when viewing a pull request while logged in
body:
### Description

We hit a 500 Internal Server Error when viewing a pull request while one user is logged in. The same pull request is viewable for other users or when the user logs out of gitea.

I found this message in gitea.log:

2025/06/24 16:28:52 services/gitdiff/gitdiff.go:1361:SyncUserSpecificDiff() [E] Could not get changed files between e6b6c01d0dc37b0e52b20cb558f967219f3c07be and 284cc007c63d1a560da9dfd3cd7d62f5e5fc3121 for pull request 258 in repo with path .../repo.git. Assuming no changes. Error: %!w(*git.runStdError=&{0xc00e8af470 fatal: bad object e6b6c01d0dc37b0e52b20cb558f967219f3c07be

With some study of the repo, it appears that this pull request has been force-pushed, and commit e6b6c01 has been removed by the garbage collection.

Cross checking with pull.go, I think this may be where the problem lies: the call to SyncUserSpecificDiff() failed because of the non-existent commit, and the code just throws a ServerError(). (I'm not familiar with the code base, but the comment seems to match the symptom we are observing)

        // if we're not logged in or only a single commit (or commit range) is shown we
        // have to load only the diff and not get the viewed information
        // as the viewed information is designed to be loaded only on latest PR
        // diff and if you're signed in.
        var reviewState *pull_model.ReviewState
        if ctx.IsSigned && !willShowSpecifiedCommit && !willShowSpecifiedCommitRange {
                reviewState, err = gitdiff.SyncUserSpecificDiff(ctx, ctx.Doer.ID, pull, gitRepo, diff, diffOptions)
                if err != nil {
                        ctx.ServerError("SyncUserSpecificDiff", err)
                        return
                }
        }


### Gitea Version

1.24.2

No
